body.p: This document describes troubleshooting and additional configuration steps for Windows instances.
This document contains the following sections:

li.xref: Upstream proxies are not set in DEAs added after cluster creation
Kato tries to install patches on Windows nodes
Windows instances created from the Images page in Horizon do not work

section.title: Upstream proxies are not set in DEAs added after cluster creation
section.p: When DEAs are added to clusters after they have been created, upstream proxies are not automatically configured. To configure upstream proxies for these nodes, do the following:

ol.li: Connect to each DEA node using SSH

Run the following commands:
kato op upstream_proxy set <proxy server> service polipo restart

section.title: Kato tries to install patches on Windows nodes
section.p: When kato patch install is run, the installer will attempt to add patches to Windows nodes. This installation will fail with the following errors:
section.codeblock: stackato@fd-core:~$ kato patch install The authenticity of host '10.0.0.36 (10.0.0.36)' can't be established. ECDSA key fingerprint is 85:72:28:b6:4a:61:27:42:f7:0c:ab:8c:12:9a:06:ca. Are you sure you want to continue connecting (yes/no)? yes Warning: Permanently added '10.0.0.36' (ECDSA) to the list of known hosts. ssh: connect to host 10.0.0.38 port 22: Connection timed out Updating kato patch on 10.0.0.38... ssh: connect to host 10.0.0.38 port 22: Connection timed out ssh: connect to host 10.0.0.40 port 22: Connection timed out Updating kato patch on 10.0.0.40... ssh: connect to host 10.0.0.40 port 22: Connection timed out

section.title: Windows instances created from the Images page in Horizon do not work
section.p: This behavior is by design. Windows instances must be created with the cf-mgmt tool or through Horizon.
